story:
My name is Olivia Willie and I am a rising super-senior music education major at Brevard College, which is a small, liberal arts school in Brevard, NC.  I hope to be graduating in the spring of 2015 with a B.A. for Music Education and a teaching license.  However, due to unforeseen and uncontrollable circumstances, I am having to complete my education in a full fifth year, rather than finishing at the end of this semester, which places a financial burden on my family and myself.  My bill has come back from the school, and without your help, I won't be able to finish my very last year of college!   I have worked extremely hard for the past four years, making Dean's List 3 of those 4, participating in a prestigious wind-ensemble of 80 some-odd students from around the country, and performing various fund-raising gigs regularly in the past year and a half.  To pause my education simply because I cannot afford the balance is unacceptable to me, especially since I am so close to being done. I have come too far to be forced to stop due to things that are out of mine or my parents' control.  Your contributions are going to help achieve my dream of becoming a music teacher to future high-school students, and hopefully, encourage the world to become a more musical place.


Ultimate Goal and Perks:

Currently my bill stands at roughly $3,000 (USD).  I have contacted my adviser for scholarships and am currently awaiting her response.  In the meantime, I must take action in case those end up being a bust.

With every donation, a special thank you will be placed in the program of my Senior Recital.  Depending on the amount donated, my mom has agreed to tag-team with me to help make you all some awesome crafts in thanks for your support in making my dreams become realities!  She really enjoys crafting and making creative things, and she also wants to see her daughter succeed in school.  She believes this is a wonderful cause and an even more wonderful way to help.

If my financial goal on Indiegogo is not met, your money will not be put to waste! Every penny received will help buffer the expenses of schooling.  Rest assured your donations will be directly applied to paying the balance.  My family and I thank you for your generosity from the bottom of our hearts!


Spreading the Word:

Trust me when I say that we understand being unable to help monetarily, and that's perfectly fine!  What you can do is share this page to all your friends and get the word out to as many people as possible.  We appreciate every effort made to help ensure that I am able to finish my educational career with ultimate success.


So much gratitude and God bless you all,

Olivia and the Willie Family

story:
Tapp - The teachers app

A digital educational planner for 21st Century teaching
  • We are a team of teachers with primary and secondary experience covering from NQT to middle management as subject leaders and pastoral. 
  • The team also includes an experienced web designer and school computing and technology manager.
  • We entered into the profession because we care about the future of the children in our care and we recognise the need for the teacher to be motivated and energised whilst being fully prepared for the rigours of the classroom.
Tapp is a multi-device Educational Planner which encompasses all your teaching needs, bringing edutech in line with the classroom needs of the teacher, middle management and senior leaders. Our fundraising website TappGo.com develops the product description in more depth - and will explain how it is available on your phone, tablet and computer. 

We want to raise £60,000 to bring to life an idea which has been in development for the last twelve months. We have carried out market research across age-groups and countries and are confident that Tapp is a much desired and needed product across numerous continents. 

Your contribution will help make Tapp a reality and will impact on the future of millions of children worldwide.  We will continue to teach and plan to incorporate Tapp into our daily practise. 


What We Need & What You Get

The funding we need is to allow the first stage of Tapp to be built and hosted for a minimum of  twelve months with support, it will also allow us to have minimum advertising - and as you are all aware the bigger the audience the greater the usage the sooner Tapp can become independent. If fundraising stretches beyond this amount we be able to introduce phase 2 and more advanced features in the initial build, benefiting all those in the classroom and at home. 

We are using flexible funding in order that when we reach the first 50% we will be able to start building Tapp - the teachers digital planner - in order that we can bring it to you sooner. 


    The Impact

    Tapp is not an ordinary educational app - it is a sophisticated product which brings your teaching practise into line with the technology available - all in one place. 

    • Teaching is often be separated into three areas: Planning and preparation, teaching and assessment - however we also recognise there are many areas in which this and other expectations can be streamlined to make our workplace a more efficient and happy place to be.
    • Tapp offers significant improvement to the teachers work/life balance.
    • There are opportunities to improve communication with the home for school and the individual teachers which choose to subscribe to Tapp. 
    • Tapp has numerous green benefits in a paper-heavy world. 
    • Tapp will ultimately improve the performance of the teacher in the classroom which will improve the results for your children and the employees of the future. 


    Risks & Challenges

    We recognise that there are numerous existing apps /educational platforms available to teachers, however they are all small pieces to the giant jigsaw which is the life of the teacher. Tapp completes that jigsaw by using joined-up thinking. 


    Tapp will work because it is made by teachers for teachers, This is why we want to offer you an opportunity to invest so that it is not an established corporate produced item which teaching moulds too; but is instead a product with the flexibility to be moulded to the individual teacher needs. 


    With over 500,000 UK teachers and millions more worldwide - Tapp will provide an essential service to thousands if not millions of users globally. 


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please can you share on social media - whether a tweet or share on facebook. We would love for you to join our circle on google+ and share with us on pinterest.


      It would also be great if you could print off the A4 poster on our fundraising website TappGo.com for friends, colleagues or the staffroom to encourage as many other people to invest in the future of Tapp and the education of your children and future employees. 

      To  be updated and informed about all developments please complete your details on the TappGo.com website.

story:
The Talented Tenth

TIOME.org (pronounced: thee-ohm) harkens to the days and ideology of our great educators W.E.B. Du Bois and Booker T. Washington when the belief was first championed that approximately a tenth of the population (the “talented tenth”) would lead in the fields of minority education; hence the name TIOME – the talented tenth of minority education.  These exceptional individuals were destined to become our scientists and lawyers, our master builders and mechanics and our prized athletes and entertainers.  These are our future leaders.

The purpose of this campaign is to raise working capital for prototype development of a recruitment oriented education platform for the world's new Talented Tenth by August 2014. This platform is being developed in collaboration with the Computer Science Department at Howard University in Washington DC and tested in Trenton, Prince George, Fairfax and Arlington schools.

   

The Challenge

How many colleges or trade schools did you apply to? Most good students apply to at least four, two ideal and two safety. But, why should anyone have to apply at all? Why shouldn't all students get treated like athletes and be recruited? Or, like customers for any major product who get wooed by the brand? Our goal at tiome.org is to create a global social media and education platform to help students get recruited by schools around the world. We feel that you are the Talented Tenth. Your talent may be academics or sports or design or mechanics. We believe that everyone has special gifts that just need exposure.

       

The challenging statistics: 50% of all high school students
go to college or enter trade school while less than 12% of minorities attend
college or trade school. According to the National Urban League, this
achievement gap is leading to fewer and fewer meaningful career opportunities.
This problem is compounded because guidance counselors are
overwhelmed leaving most students unaware of the thousands of schools
and organizations around the world eager to help them fulfill their
dreams. At tiome.org students will create their professional profiles for colleges and trade/craft schools. If you or someone you know would benefit from attending college or trade school, support tiome.org.

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT, so please help and refer a friend! These are our future leaders.

    

The tiome.org team

Howard University’s Computer Sciences Department has joined us to develop the world’s first online professional networking and education platform dedicated to serving the world’s Talented Tenth. TIOME will serve students interested in crafts and the trades as well as those interested in academics and the sciences. TIOME will begin identifying students as early as middle school and assist colleges and trade schools in their worldwide recruitment programs.


Team member include: Sherwood Brown (Video) - MBA (Online College Counseling), Dr. Legand Burge - Department Chair of Howard University Computer Sciences, Dr. Grant Warner - Co-Founder of ConnectYard.com, Yvette Carter - Associate Producer for theater, TV and movies, Lamont Johnson (technology) - former IBM Systems Engineer, Gary Cassis (MA) and Donald Brown (MBA) - Principal(s) of TWTGroup LLC.

story:
This is Vincent Smith and you may recognize me from college football at Michigan.  After graduating, some of my team mates and I wanted to something meaningful with our education and opportunities from football.  So we created #EATING as a way to give back.

#EATING is our informatics project that uses technology to connect communities from resources. Our first major project is creating local gardening programs for our cities in Florida where we are from and cities in Michigan where we ended up.

#EATING gardens are excellent sources of nutritious foods for communities that lack access to fresh vegetables. Our goal is to grow food, feed people, and sell produce at local famers markets. Installing community gardens in urban areas provides job training, nutritious food, activities for youth, and opportunities for sustainable economic growth.


We decided to start with community gardens because we were so inspired by the great gardening projects that are in Detroit and also by the Farmers Market in Ann Arbor.  Football gave us the chance to start something great and that is what we are doing with #EATING.

We started in Pahokee, Florida and are expanding with Denard into his hometown of Deerfield Beach, Florida.  We are also expanding into Michigan.

You can help us by sharing our story with a friend, wearing one of our shirts, donating, or volunteering your time.  If you look below you can see some of our shirts and more information about what we are doing. When you support our teams think about supporting our local communities too. 





OUR #EATING SHIRTS:

#EATING shirts are made with USA cotton and printed with eco-friendly water based inks. They wash up soft and likely will become one of your favorite shirts. 





MORE ABOUT OUR GARDENS:


Our #EATING project was possible in the first place because of the support of Michigan fans and Alumni and readers of reddit and football blogs like Maize and Goblue and Mgoblog.  

We started #EATING because we knew that we could make important positive changes and set a good example for the youth from our neighborhoods.  We also know from football that we need to use teamwork to be successful.  We were lucky to partner with Urban Greenworks of Miami, Florida.

UGW runs select food security and gardening programs through out South East Florida. Roger Horne, MPH (also a Michigan Alumni) is mentoring us through the process of creating a community garden and training program.  We are learning how to build ties with farmers markets so that our gardens can be profitable and self-sustainable in the long run

Pahokee was once the "Winter Vegetable Capital of the World" and now there is a lack of local industry.  Presently, unemployment is greater than 30%.  There is an opportunity to rebuild the local economy through agriculture and farming.





FUNDING GOALS:

Our minimum goal is $15,000 for funding for Pahokee, fl.


+$15,000 -  #EATING Pahokee, Florida Basic Funding

Goals include outreach and nutrition classes.


+$30,000 - #EATING expansion into Denard's hometown of Deerfield Beach, Florida.


+$45,000 - #EATING programing for Deerfield Beach, Florida

Goals include creating ties with regional farmers market and selling produce. Integration of elementary school and nutrition classes.  Integration of youth after-school activities.


 



THANK YOU FOR READING   - TEAM EATING 



OTHER OPTIONAL GIFTS:




The rewards fulfillment and shipping is being handled by a Michigan-based company with 10 years of experience.

story:
All of us at Wood River Wave, the community effort to rehabilitate a dangerous low head dam and headgate on the Big Wood River into a safe recreation area with a surfable wave, would like to thank everyone for the tremendous outpouring of support that has been shown in the past two months. Due to this, the WRW is now within reach of the first financial goal--having enough funds to hire river park engineer, Scott Shipley.

We are only $2000 shy of this goal! We need to finish the final leg of this initial fundraising effort prior to December 1st in order to hire Scott Shipley and his firm, S2O to draft design plans to present to the City of Bellevue, Wood River Irrigation District #45 and adjacent landowners for approval.

Once the plans are approved, we will be able to submit applications for grants to fund the construction phase as well as apply for necessary permits.

If everyone on our Facebook page donates $10 (the price of 2 lattes!), we will have the necessary funds required to hire Scott Shipley and S2O to produce the engineering plans we so desperately need in order to keep the momentum going.

Thank you for your help!

story:
BREAKING NEWS: 

Our Board of Directors has agreed to match any new donations starting today, up to $3,000, so let's all double up on the impact! (And the glitter too!)



In March 2014 a fire broke out in the apartment directly above our school at 72 Warren Street. It triggered the fire sprinklers and flooded all of the floors below, including our administrative offices and performance space! Luckily no one was hurt in the fire and most of our classroom space was spared. However, parts of our school sustained significant water damage and must be completely renovated before we can inhabit them again.

Good news: 

We have insurance! 

Bad news:

Parts of our school are unusable and insurance will only cover a portion of what was destroyed.

Thank you to the Tribeca Trib for creating the video below. Click here to read The Trib's article about the disaster.


The insurance timeline for rebuilding estimates that it will be 6 months before we can use our space again but we need to fix things now so that we can focus on what's most important: making more music and more art with our amazing students!

Our computers were ruined as well as other technological equipment, chairs, desks, phones and musical instruments (including our director’s piano). Funds from this campaign will go to replacing necessary equipment so that we can get our offices up and running.

We need you to help us get back on our feet so we can continue providing the best music and art education to the families of New York City.

Church Street school is a not-for-profit 501c3 organization. All contributions are tax deductible!

Church Street School is a not-for-profit arts school and community center in Lower Manhattan. We are a creative centerpiece of the neighborhood where students of all ages and backgrounds come to learn, play music, make art and connect with one another.

Since 1990 we have been teaching music and art classes in Tribeca and our alumni have gone on to become successful musicians, artists, actors, photographers, university professors and poets. Last year we gave out over $40,000 in scholarships for private music lessons, preschool, after school art classes, teen programs, summer camps and more.

We are professional teaching artists, musicians and educators who love what we do and believe deeply in the importance of nurturing the creative voices of our youth. We are driven by the idea that music and art are the keys to cultivating creative minds, self expression and confidence! 

Church Street School is a community keystone. We’ve taught over 10,000 students and we believe that inspiring students of today to be better problem solvers, creative thinkers and communicators starts with an education in the arts.

For almost 25 years, Church Street School has survived. In the face of a changing neighborhood, September 11th, the 2008 recession, Hurricane Sandy and intense competition from for-profit educational centers, we have weathered it all because of the amazing support of the downtown community and our conviction that art in New York City is worth saving.

As arts education is downsized in public schools, we fight to offer affordable classes and scholarships so that all families have access to art and music.

Help us keep creating and keep inspiring our students!

We are hoping to raise $30,000 to:


If we meet our goal and raise $40,000 or more, we’ll also give our preschool and afterschool art classrooms a face lift with a coat of fresh paint, new shelving, storage, art supplies and art tables!


Your contribution is greatly appreciated, but you can also help by spreading the word. Let friends, family and coworkers and anyone else know about what happened to our school. Share this campaign with them and let them know that Church Street School is as important to you as it is to us.

By making a tax deductible contribution to our fund you’ll help us to keep providing inspiration, creativity and self discovery for students in New York City. We need your help so we can make more music and make more art!

Thank you for your support and believing in the power of the arts!

We are a creative centerpiece of the neighborhood where students of all ages and backgrounds come to learn, play music, make art and connect with one another.Since 1990 we have been teaching music and art classes in Tribeca and our alumni have gone on to become successful musicians, artists, actors, photographers, university professors and poets. Last year we gave out over $40,000 in scholarships for private music lessons, preschool, after school art classes, teen programs, summer camps and more.We are professional teaching artists, musicians and educators who love what we do and believe deeply in the importance of nurturing the creative voices of our youth. We are driven by the idea that music and art are the keys to cultivating creative minds, self expression and confidence! Church Street School is a community keystone. We’ve taught over 10,000 students and we believe that inspiring students of today to be better problem solvers, creative thinkers and communicators starts with an education in the arts. For almost 25 years, Church Street School has survived. In the face of a changing neighborhood, September 11th, the 2008 recession, Hurricane Sandy and intense competition from for-profit educational centers, we have weathered it all because of the amazing support of the downtown community and our conviction that art in New York City is worth saving.As arts education is downsized in public schools, we fight to offer affordable classes and scholarships so that all families have access to art and music. Help us keep creating and keep inspiring our students!We are hoping to raise $30,000 to:If we meet our goal and raise $40,000 or more, we’ll also give our preschool and afterschool art classrooms a face lift with a coat of fresh paint, new shelving, storage, art supplies and art tables!Your contribution is greatly appreciated, but you can also help by spreading the word. Let friends, family and coworkers and anyone else know about what happened to our school. Share this campaign with them and let them know that Church Street School is as important to you as it is to us.By making a tax deductible contribution to our fund you’ll help us to keep providing inspiration, creativity and self discovery for students in New York City. We need your help so we can make more music and make more art!Thank you for your support and believing in the power of the arts!

story:
TAKING THE PLANETARIUM TO THE KIDS

West GYSTC has been taking the planetarium "Star Lab" to students for 20 years, and as you might imagine, time and usage have taken their toll. We need to refurbish our equipment, replace some parts, and have it all professionally cleaned.  

Though we are located on the University campus, we are an independent not-for-profit science center. The Star Lab is one of the most requested services from the 100-plus schools we serve. Thousands of students benefit and learn through the use of this equipment each year. Without upkeep, it will not last more than another couple of years.  The Star Lab experience is inspirational, unforgettable, and often one of the most exciting events for schools that have had field trip budgets slashed. Help us keep it working and traveling to schools.

Help us keep it working and traveling to schools.

story:
The Digital Justice Project

Every year thousands of children go missing in Cambodia and the surrounding regions. Many of these children are lost to the sex trade or forced labor.

While families can file a missing children’s report, there is currently no mechanism to track cases of missing and trafficked children in Cambodia, or to help police to investigate, find them, and bring them home.  The Digital Justice Project provides a solution to this problem by creating a database and website that will track missing persons cases, allowing the public to report and look for missing loved ones. 

The Digital Justice Project will allow police and government officials immediate access to open cases, and vital information, helping them to find and bring missing persons home. 

It will also provide the first accurate numbers of trafficked children in Cambodia.

Some heroes have come forward with $60,000 of seed money to get this database and website built and begin the process of logging the missing. But, we need YOUR help!

We are asking you to join us in launching the implementation phase if this project. 

Your donation will make it possible to hire Cambodian Nationals who can collect and enter information on cases of missing children in Cambodia. It will fund a campaign throughout the country to alert the public and allow them to report cases of missing family members and friends. It will build capacity in the police and government as we work together with them to solve and track cases. We will connect other organizations in the region to cases they may be able to help solve, further assisting the Cambodian National Police.

The Digital Justice Project will help bring children home and through greater awareness and speed of tracking efforts, work to prevent human trafficking at its source.

What’s in it For You

· Knowing you have helped turn the tide on human trafficking in Cambodia. Your contribution goes toward modernizing the anti-human trafficking movement in Southeast Asia by linking technology, law enforcement, and social services.

· A legacy in building a system that can be used to map trends, identify trafficking networks, and is positioned to grow into a regional tool.

· Depending on your pledge amount you can receive: a collectible and frameable postcard with handwritten thank you, a framed photograph of Cambodia, a painting by local artist, or a free all-inclusive Engagement Trip to Cambodia to learn about our organization and the anti-human trafficking movement in the region.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially you can help by getting the word out! Please use the Indiegogo share tools to share the project in your network so we can reach our goal. If you are a programmer, journalist, or media expert who has some experience to share, we'd love to hear from you!

story:
Short Summary:

Deep down in my heart, all I want to do is be a great mom for Ayden and make the lives of others richer!  So I’m stepping out and making a positive career change.  Ayden and I are looking for many forms of support as I take accreditations to become a Myers Briggs administrator and a certified Life Coach. I am developing a business called reSource Coaching and Consulting. Life coaching for personal, professional or spiritual development that celebrates the unique gifts within you. 


On May 6-9th, I will attend a Myers Briggs certification course in Seattle Washington. 

Cost break down:

•MBTI certification $1595

•Lodging and meals $550

•Minimum for books and supplies $450

Total money needed by April 18th to register: $2,595


If you see that I'm nearing my goal, please do not let that stop you from donating.  The long term goal is $10,000 for the Invite Change program in Kirkland, Wa. Any exceeding balance will support this transition and training.


There are links to the right that include various forms of financial donations.  For some of the donations there are valuable perks.  After the Myers Briggs certification, I will be eager to consult with those interested in services.  Don't let distance stop you, we can still connect via phone or modern technology such as Skype!  If you already know your MBTI type, there is a second assessment available to delve deeper into your specific results. 


If you do not have a cushion in your budget right now to financially support, please consider other ways to support Ayden and I during this transition:


Could you help with:

•Emotional support in the form of letters and emails

•Spiritual support in the form of prayers and verses

•Childcare for Ayden (I have an extensive list of needs for the next few months)

•Books from my recommended reading list

•Web site set up

•Personal photos for website

•Graphics for branding

•Business cards

•Grant writing assistance to apply for grants to benefit partnerships with local non profits

•Tax and financial consulting re: self employment

•Hotel points or hotel sponsorship (this could potentially reduce the cost needed by April 18th)

•Spaces to conduct workshops in once completion of MBTI certification

•Coffee dates to process out loud the things I’m learning (my favorite places are Corina Bakery, Metronome, Bluebeard and Starbucks)

•Connections to friends who will want to take the MBTI assessment

•Monthly donations to cover support during this transiton


Life coaching?  What’s that? What will you do?

You may be wondering, "What is the difference between a coach and a therapist?" A therapist is able to take a reflective look back on life to answer deep questions, but a coach partners with an individual to provide resources needed. While I think therapy is very important, I am more interested in meeting people where they are at now, identifying gaps and connecting them with the resources to be where they want to be.  I love life coaching because it is evidence based practice using the best available knowledge available today! Theory and skills are integrated to a holistic approach. 

Myers Briggs typology test is a personality test founded on over 80 years of scientific research conducted around the globe.  The simple, but accurate, questions shed light onto 16 different personality typologies.  MBTI assessment analyses how people gain their energy, how they process information, conduct decision making, and therefore act out lifestyle.  Personal information uncovered is useful in career planning, stress management, conflict management, leadership and team development. 

My long term goal is to complete the life coach certification program, Invite Change.  It is a yearlong program out of Kirkland Washington. Upon completion and mentoring, I will receive a certification from the International Coaching Federation; which is the governing board for all coaching. 

A first practical step in this direction is to take the MBTI certification course, which will apply credits towards the Invite Change program. With this certification I will be able to administer and consult others to a deeper discovering of their identity.  Specifically, there are three areas where I am interested in offering this knowledge; personal, professional or spiritual development. I envision working within educational settings, doing one on one consulting, and partnering with nonprofit agencies working towards social justice.

My goal is to become financially sustainable through coaching and consulting. I am partnering my lifelong love of learning with a holistic approach to helping others. Through self-employment I will be able to spend more time with Ayden and actively participate in his life now.  I will also be equipped, and freed up to serve and love others in my city. I care deeply about education, empowerment, freedom for the brokenhearted, family, love and my God. 

I am now actively involved with Soma Tacoma, where I’ve been making amazing connections and practical ways to serve and love others. I am getting connected to Network Tacoma, and the work they do to assist people transitioning from homelessness.  The hope and services they offer are amazing!  Dope Church is also another organization in Tacoma that is in the beginning stages of development and ministry.  The leaders have amazing aspirations of rescuing and loving those trapped in forms of human trafficking. I’m hopeful for the possibilities to work alongside these organizations.

I am excited and a little nervous about this journey, but I know deep down that it is one I am supposed to take.  I am most excited about the ability to give back to my community and to celebrate the unique ways in which we are all formed and created. This knowledge is important in our understanding of how to live our lives in response.  

I can’t wait to spend more time with Ayden and celebrate the gift that he is to me.  He is looking forward to swimming lessons and more time with his friends.  Please like my facebook page and look for updates on this journey. I desire to build community around this work and for it to serve others, including yourself!  I am excited to share this with you.  Thank you in advance for the many ways you will develop reSource! 



P.s. If you want to read more about my journey and my heart for social justice, please read the attachment listed under "links".

story:
We did it!

$18,047, 2,670 website visits, 120 donors from 6 different countries.

Watch our blog to follow our progress. kanayarit.wordpress.com  
It's going to be exciting.

¡Mexicanos!

Hace dos años, el Colegio Patria empezó un programa piloto para aprendizaje en línea. Fue un  gran éxito. Los alumnos aprendieron matemáticas en línea. El próximo año, queremos añadir inglés y programación, pero no tenemos suficiente tabletas. Esta campaña es para comprar 45 tabletas adicionales. ¡Por favor contribuye y se parte del cambio que se está generando en tu País! Y recuerda invertir en un sistema educativo básico de calidad puede hacer la diferencia en el futuro de nuestros niños.

The Little School that Could

In January 2014, El Colegio Patria, a poor school in an agricultural pueblo in Mexico, started an online learning project. With 16 donated used computers (6 have since died) and 10 spanking new tablets, teachers started enrolling twenty students at a time in the Khan Academy. The kids came after school, for an hour, every day, for three weeks. In that short time, they moved from no online learning skills whatever to masters of the site AND they fell in love with the beauty of math. 

Now 107 students from Grade 3 to Grade 9 are learning math online from Salman Khan, one of the best teachers in the world.

English online is next. Then computer programming.

Other schools and underused computer labs in our region are already following our model. We want our success to be repeated. Integrating technology into education can give every Mexican kid a chance.

We've published all our resources for learning online on our bilingual website. Check us out at Khan Academy Matématicas. 

Help a school, help a country. 

What We Need & What You Get

To achieve our goal, we don't need one tablet per child, but we do need more than 20 working computers. Before the next school year, we hope to set up one 5-tablet online learning station in each classroom.  That will give us a flexible learning environment that includes both real and online teachers. Students will be able to learn at their own pace, share ideas, work peer-to-peer, and maybe even show their parents and teachers a thing or two.

Our campaign is 45 days. Our goal is 45 tablets, one tablet a day.

  • 45 tablets at $350 each,
  • 20 keyboard cases at $75 each (to increase tablet productivity, effectively turning them into mini-laptops) 
  • 25 protective covers at $25 each so students can work outside of the box.

If we don't reach our goal, every dollar earned will go to tablets.

If we exceed our goal, we'll start building a real classroom to replace our tarp-covered outdoor learning centre. 

Our Results

El Colegio Patria knows how to leverage a few $$ into a lot of learning. With an investment of less than $10,000 the school has already become
  • the first school in Mexico to be recognized by Khan Academy International
  • a leader in online learning for other schools in its region
  • an exciting place for kids to learn from the world's best teachers.

We want to share our success with Spanish speaking kids everywhere. 

The Impact

The future is digital. Everybody knows it. Children without computer skills will have no chance in the coming world economy. BBC News reported on May 20, 2014 that Mexico ranked 34th of 34 countries in math education. BBC News

Kids who live in poor countries with low education budgets, like Mexico and most countries in Central and South America, suffer the greatest risk of being left behind. These children face a yawning digital divide between poverty and prosperity. 

Help build a bridge to get them to the other side.


Source Data: U.S. Education Spending vs The World. Posted Mar 26, 2012 by George F. Huhn. Here's the link: Bubble Chart

Can't Contribute Financially?

Here's what else you can do: 

  • Spread the word—Corre la Voz—Tell anyone you can think of about our campaign.
  • Translate—Khan Academy español is less than perfect. If you're fluent in Spanish, great. If you're learning, even better. Practice by contributing to the Khan Academy Spanish translation project. Even translating one sentence helps.
  • Multiply. Use Indiegogo share tools to leverage your influence.

 Kids Can! Let's get Mexican Kids Online.

Grade 7 soaring past their Khan Academy Goal

Gracias!

Every donor becomes an Amigo on our website. Because our first donation came from Canada, land of the grizzly, we’ve named our Donor Categories after a famous family of bears. Our Perks live in the imagination—just like the 3 Bears—which makes you an unforgettable part of a great story. That's a perk that's priceless.

story:
Short Summary

As you may not already know, I am started a course in September to become a certified Pilates teacher.  I reached my initial goal last summer for the deposit, but I am continuing to pay for the course as I make it through each level.  I had to defer for a little while and have rejoined a larger and more cohesive group.  I will have my test at the end of this year, but I'm well on my way and already teaching clients to fulfill my apprenticeship hours, observing classes, and doing my own self practice!

As I had noted with this initial campaign - I’d love to share my love of exercise and newly found love of Pilates with others!  I am able to reopen this campaign to continue funding, so I figured...Why not!?

The program that I am taking combines classical Pilates with a modern holistic approach to movement-science using visualization and touch, including anatomical education and insights.  Classical Pilates is much more universal than other new-fangled strains which means that I will be able to use it anywhere.

Bottom line: I want to learn and I want to work with people in a positive, fun way!

What I Need & What You Get

Break it down nah:

  • The certification program is $4,675.  This includes all Workshops, Anatomy Courses, Studio Access, Certification Manual, Anatomy Books and Study Guide, and then the final exam fee.
  • I will learn more about myself and the mind/body connection, which I have already begun by taking Pilates classes.  I would love to continue this path and then share my knowledge with others.
  • The deposit for the program is $1,500 (GOAL MET!)  After that I will make payments prior to beginning each of the 5 levels of the program, which will be an additional $3,000, divided up.  The final exam fee is $175.  The total is $4,675.
    If I manage to raise even MORE than that, the money would go to continuing a journey in the fitness field (additional certification, personal training, workshops, etc.)

I am reaching out to all y'all in the hopes you can help with the program as I balance my work at the record label, the bar, and this certification program.  The initial deposit is $1500 which I have set for my goal and anything beyond that will go towards the other payments over the course of the program. 

The Impact

Let's face it, I know that I'm not saving the world, but I would love to help people in my life and my community.  I'm just a single person looking to share what makes me happy because there are enough jerks out there in the world:

  • Pilates is an amazing exercise technique, but classes tends to be pricey.  If I get certified I would love to help teach you, if you are interested.
  • I'm no quitter!  Everything that I go for I follow through with.  Starting a band?  Did it.  Starting a bicycle gang?  Electric Pythons ruled the streets.  Moving to LA?  Drove that Honda Civic cross-country.  I'm not a talker.  I'm a doer.  So let's do this.
  • IndieGoGo says "Make it real for people and build trust."  This is for realz.
  • This course is through a private studio, which I am happy to share additional information about if you care to ask.  For your donation you will know where the money is going, it's not going to some CEO head at some charitable foundation.

Risks & Challenges

ln all honesty it's a risk-free project, but the challenge is for me to meet my goal.  I will find a way to do the program as I am 100% determined to do it.  Help with the financial aspect will just allow me to have more time and flexibility to work within the program.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • I know that you can't all help with a financial contribution, but if you could help me by getting the word out and make some noise about my campaign, it could help!
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • If some guy can raise like 60K to make potato salad, surely I can raise money to make potato salad AND get my Pilates certification!

I truly appreciate you taking the time to look at this!

XOXOX

Allie Justice



Note: Some of you may not know this about me, but I put MYSELF through a private college without financial assistance from others.
story_txt:
Short Summary 

As you may not already know, I am started a course in September to become a certified Pilates teacher.  I reached my initial goal last summer for the deposit, but I am continuing to pay for the course as I make it through each level.  I had to defer for a little while and have rejoined a larger and more cohesive group.  I will have my test at the end of this year, but I'm well on my way and already teaching clients to fulfill my apprenticeship hours, observing classes, and doing my own self practice!
As I had noted with this initial campaign - I’d love to share my love of exercise and newly found love of Pilates with others!  I am able to reopen this campaign to continue funding, so I figured...Why not!?
The program that I am taking combines classical Pilates with a modern holistic approach to movement-science using visualization and touch, including anatomical education and insights.  Classical Pilates is much more universal than other new-fangled strains which means that I will be able to use it anywhere.
Bottom line: I want to learn and I want to work with people in a positive, fun way!   What I Need & What You Get Break it down nah: 
The certification program is $4,675.  This includes all Workshops, Anatomy Courses, Studio Access, Certification Manual, Anatomy Books and Study Guide, and then the final exam fee. I will learn more about myself and the mind/body connection, which I have already begun by taking Pilates classes.  I would love to continue this path and then share my knowledge with others.
 The deposit for the program is $1,500 (GOAL MET!)  After that I will make payments prior to beginning each of the 5 levels of the program, which will be an additional $3,000, divided up.  The final exam fee is $175.  The total is $4,675.If I manage to raise even MORE than that, the money would go to continuing a journey in the fitness field (additional certification, personal training, workshops, etc.) 
  

I am reaching out to all y'all in the hopes you can help with the program as I balance my work at the record label, the bar, and this certification program.  The initial deposit is $1500 which I have set for my goal and anything beyond that will go towards the other payments over the course of the program. 
The Impact Let's face it, I know that I'm not saving the world, but I would love to help people in my life and my community.  I'm just a single person looking to share what makes me happy because there are enough jerks out there in the world: 
Pilates is an amazing exercise technique, but classes tends to be pricey.  If I get certified I would love to help teach you, if you are interested. story:
Crowdfunding the

2nd CommonsFest

BUILDING COMMON VALUES

Heraklion, Crete 9th till 11th of May 2014




στα Ελληνικά
in Italiano
en español
coming soon in German

CommonsFest is an initiative to promote freedom of knowledge (or free knowledge) and peer-to-peer collaboration for the creation and management of the Commons. A philosophy that has spread through free software communities and extends to many aspects of our daily lives, such as the arts, governance, construction of machinery, tools and other goods. Through an exhibition, talks, screenings and workshops, the aim of the festival is to promote the achievements of this philosophy to the public and become a motive for further adoption.


What are your goals?

The goals of CommonsFest are:

  • To highlight solutions to our everyday needs offered by the Commons.

  • To inform for available tools that help us create and manage the Commons.

  • To explore new ways of collaborating, new tools for creating innovations to accelerate the process of participation in the Commons.

Why is it important to contribute?

After years of economic crisis here in Greece we have abandoned any faith in all that is old. So even when it comes to fund raising we are experimenting with new more participatory and open ways.

This way of covering the costs is more consistent with the philosophy of the commons ie participation of as many as possible in the realization of the festival. Apart from funding, we try to adhere to all of our activities with open call for entries, collaborative discussions and actions and publishing all our material under free licenses.

Our effort is part of a global effort for a fair and world of peers where all contribute according to their abilities and take according to their needs.

CommonsFest would not exist if it was not for all of you.

How the money will be used?

We try to keep our financial needs to a minimum, nevertheless there are still some things that we can not meet without money.

This amount we estimate that will cover the expenses below:

  • tickets for some participants

  • printing costs

  • cost of food supplies for participants and volunteers

How else can you help?

Spread our campaign!

  • Share it on social networks,

  • Write a personal message and send to friends and acquaintances,

  • Talk to friends, even to those who you might think that they will not contribute financially, but they can contribute in other ways or just to learn about Commons.

Follow us on twitter & facebook.

Sign up to our newsletter if you want to be informed.

Finally , the most important help you can give is to create new Commons and become the protagonists of the next beautiful story that will be discussed in CommonsFest.

Open source festival

After the festival we will release the recorded talks with English subtitles under CC-BY-SA license, accompanied by any presentation material. Also, all articles, graphics and the organizational know-how will be released freely in an effort to open source the festival. We offer help to anyone who wants to reproduce the festival in their location.

Stickers


Participants

Talks

Building a society of Commons
George Dafermos - FLOK Society project, Ecuador
Creative Commons Licences in Practice: Cases of CC Use and Lessons from the field
Prodromos Tsiavos, Maria Mertzani - Creative Commons Greece
Accomplishing art projects through crowdfunding
Giannis Farsaris - OpenΒook
From the bottom of the sea to the edge of the sky: school projects based on open hardware and free knowledge.
Astrinos Tsoutsoudakis, Saitakis Angelici, Apostolaki Marianthe, Raptakis Panagiotis - ViannoSat & Hydrobot
Peer-to-Peer desktop production: Opportunities and challenges
Vasilis Niaros - P2P Lab
From open source to open content the role of GFOSS
Theodoros Karounos - GFOSS
Towards an open festival
en oiko
Outlining forms of open networks
Platform
Open data and open knowledge
Vasilis Chrysos & Charalambos Bratsas  - FOSS Office / OKF Greece
Self-managed spaces, forms, necessity and operation modes
to Granazi
Current system and proposal for an alternative model based on common resources
Diomedes Skalistis - Zeitgeist Movement Greece
Off-grid electricity production from open source renewable energy sources & Peer-to-peer electricity production and management for energy efficiency and self-reliance.
Costas Latoufis - Iason Kouveliotis-Lysikatos - Nea Guinea / SmartRUE NTUA
labaki hackerspace: an open community for unusual innovation, learning and sharing
Antonis Hariton - tolabaki hackerspace
Privacy and security in our mobile phone
Nikos Roussos - Digital Liberation Network
Wireless community networks sarantaporo.gr: Modern infrastructure by citizens for citizens
Vasilis Chrysos - sarantaporo.gr
Open governance
Thanassis Priftis - GFOSS
What digital freedoms we want? Grassroots policies for the intellectual Commons in Greece in crisis
Antonis Broumas - Digital Liberation Network
Work with nature , not against it
Maniadakis Michael
Socially supported agriculture
Harris Papayannakis - Zizania
Community health care, by citizens for citizens
Social Solidarity Network of Heraklion
The experiment of #rbnews: exploring the citizen journalism
Katerina Stavroula - radiobubble.gr
Outlining degrowth concepts and their links to the Commons
Alekos Pantazis
Home economics: a few words about the forgotten knowledge of sufficiency
Kallia Spyridaki - Ploumi collaborative cafe
When thinking does not reach farther than the speech
Giannis Papadopoulos & Nikos Apostolopoylos - Eleutherourgos
Natural building: regaining the lost knowledge
Manolis Ksimeris & George Ritsakis - Archanes Project

Workshops

Security in online communications
George Kiagiadakis - tolabaki hackerspace
Constructing a barel garden
Spithari
A romance of many dimensions: An introductory workshop on 3d printing
Thanassis Deligiannis - GFOSS
Mapping on OpenStreetMap
Nick Roussos - OpenStreetMap Foundation
Participating in Wikipedia
Dimitris Koukoulakis
Free your Android: Root and Custom ROMs
Costas Kalivas - tolabaki hackerspace
Installing Fedora operating system
Dimitris Glaros - Fedora
Be a Webmaker
Nick Roussos - Mozilla

Meeting of Creative Commons European Affiliates in Heraklion

Creative Commons European Affiliates have decided to honour us by choosing to have one of their two annual meetings in Heraklion on the 9th of May, starting day of the CommonsFest, so they will have the opportunity to attend it.

story:
Our Story

We are three undergraduate students at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, PA fortunate enough to have our work selected for the 10th Annual Hawaii International Conference on the Arts and Humanities. The conference runs from January 10th-13th in Waikiki and we can't wait, but we're worried about the costs. Pittsburgh is a long way away from Hawaii and flights and hotels are expensive-- in total, over $2000 a person. Carnegie Mellon is being generous where they can, but so far it isn't enough, so we're looking for other ways to raise money. Any little bit helps! And please, spread the word.


Meet the Students

Sara Keats



Sara Keats is a junior in Carnegie Mellon's BXA program studying dramaturgy and English with a history minor. She has a variety of academic interests including law and literature, performance studies, and food as culture studies. Two of her academic papers have been accepted to conference: one that examines the methodologies through which the performed identity of the tourist may be understood and the other discusses the roll of Jewish and Catholic social organizations in relief efforts during the Great Depression in Pittsburgh.  

Enrica Rosato

Enrica Rosato is a junior linguistics major and French and Francophone studies minor. Her study of linguistics primarily focuses on the social and historical aspects of language. She has had two papers accepted to the Conference; one discusses the problems facing contemporary Pennsylvania German, and the other is a comparison of the natural and scripted versions of casual conversation in American English.

Samantha Zucker


Samantha is a senior in the interdisciplinary program with concentrations in Communications Design and Linguistics. Her project, The Fearbox, helps viewers acknowledge and overcome their fears by writing and submitting them. You can check out more about the project and submit your own fears at the-fearbox.tumblr.com

story:
Short Summary

We all cried at the end of the King's Speech when King George VI made his powerful speech to help the people of England.  When I saw that movie, I said to myself. "They nailed it."  That is an accurate assesment of what it is like to stutter.  I am very fortunate to have overcome my stutter, but many more people out there haven't.  That's where we come in.

I've made it my mission to give back.  What truly motivates me is to help others make their dreams come true.  I'm so thrilled to be able to do something that I love.  With your help, I am going to be able to change lives.

What I Need & What You Get

I am creating a project called : 30 Days to Fluency.  I want to help people who stutter achieve fluent speech.

I am a person who stutters who achieved fluency.  It took a long way to get there and it led me down lots of interesting paths in life so far.

I need funds raised here to help me achieve my dreams.

I will be writing my personal history of stuttering and what it took for me to achieve lasting fluency.

In addition to the book, I will be creating an audiobook with interviews of people who have helped me along the way.

I will also be creating a website to be used as a resource for people who stutter. Here they will be able to share their experiences with people who stutter.  

If I do not reach my inital goal of $4,000 then I will donate the proceeds to the NSA foundation to help them raise awarness and to help people who stutter find coaching and success in their lives.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate financially and I know many people can't (times are hard), then the next time you see a person who stutters or have a friend who stutters, have patience and let them finish their sentences.

Give them a chance to speak.  You'll find they have so much to say!

story:
(for English go here)

¿QUÉ ES UN VIAJE AL INTERIOR?

Un Viaje al Interior es una travesía de más de 20.000 km. a través de 17 países de Latinoamérica donde queremos descubrir contigo el potencial de la gente, mostrar y reunir a personas comprometidas con la búsqueda de la excelencia en el estudio y el trabajo, y del bien común para así poder transformar nuestro entorno, nuestros países, y el mundo.

Un Viaje al Interior tiene como objetivo despertar la curiosidad por viajar, crecer, y conocer y a animar a las personas a buscar oportunidades más allá de sus límites. Este propósito lo lograremos realizando charlas y entrevistas que mantendremos con personas de los países que visitaremos, y compartiéndolas para que miles de personas reciban mensajes, ideas e historias que sirvan de ejemplo e inspiración para lograr lo extraordinario.

¿POR QUÉ NECESITAMOS TU AYUDA?

Un Viaje al Interior es un proyecto sin fines de lucro, pero al mismo tiempo tiene sus costos. A pesar de ello, estamos convencidos de que este proyecto tendrá un impacto significativo en Latinoamérica y el mundo, y logrará inspirar a muchas personas a perseguir sus sueños. Como somos estudiantes, necesitamos del apoyo de ustedes para que este proyecto se haga realidad.

¿QUÉ NECESITAMOS?

Necesitamos juntar US$10.920 para Abril de 2013.

Estos fondos cubrirán solamente una parte de los costos del viaje. Los US$10.920  serán utilizados para cubrir los costos de combustible (US$3.000), el transporte por ferry del vehículo desde Panamá a Colombia (US$1.335, es la única forma de cruzar debido a que los divide el Tapón de Darién que es una selva densa), alimentos (US$3.150) y alojamiento (US$3.435).

También planeamos comprar cámaras y equipamientos para trabajar durante el viaje. Si superamos nuestra meta, el excedente será utilizado para cubrir estos gastos.

¿QUÉ RECIBIRÁS A CAMBIO?

Además de la satisfacción personal de saber que estás formando parte de una comunidad motivadora que alienta a realizar un viaje de crecimiento, también ofrecemos diferentes niveles de gratificaciones!
Fíjate en la sección de gratificaciones en la columna derecha para más información.

¡CORRE LA VOZ!

¡Ayúdanos a expandir la voz acerca de Un Viaje al Interior! Compártelo en las redes sociales con tus amigos. Tampoco dudes en tener una conversación personal o hacer una llamada telefónica para compartirlo. ¡Todas las acciones cuentan!!!!

 

ENGLISH VERSION

What is AN INNER JOURNEY?

An Inner Journey is an adventure of more than 12,000 miles across 17 countries in Latin America. In this journey we want you to get involved in the discovery of the potential of people committed to the pursuit of excellence in education, work and wellbeing, in order to transform our environment, our countries and the world.

An Inner Journey aims to spark the curiosity for traveling, growing and learning, while encouraging people to seek opportunities beyond their immediate limits. Compiling inspiring talks and interviews with people in the countries we visit, and sharing them with thousands of people will give inspiration to achieve the extraordinary.

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?

An Inner Journey is a non-profit project, but it cannot be costless. Nevertheless, we are convinced that this project will have a significant impact because it will inspire many people to travel, explore and learn. As we are students, we need your support to make this project happen!

WHAT DO WE NEED?

We need to raise US$10,920 by April 2013.

These funds will partially cover the costs of the journey. The (US$ 10,920 will be used to cover fueling costs (US$ 3,000), transporting the car from Panama to Colombia by ferry (US$ 1,335) -which is the only way to cross the border because the road ends in the dense jungle of the Darien Gap- food (US$ 3,150) and accommodation (US$ 3,435).

We also plan to purchase cameras and equipment to record the journey. So, if we exceed US$10,920, the surplus will be used to cover these expenses.

WHAT DO YOU GET?

Besides the personal satisfaction of knowing you are helping to create an online motivational community and encouraging other people to create their own journey, we also offer multiple-level sponsorship perks!  Check out the perks section for more information.

SPREAD THE WORD!

Help us get the word out about An Inner Journey!  Share it with your friends through the social networks. Don't be afraid to go old school and have a conversation in person or make a telephone call!  Every action counts!

Un Viaje al Interior es un proyecto sin fines de lucro, pero al mismo tiempo tiene sus costos. A pesar de ello, estamos convencidos de que este proyecto tendrá un impacto significativo en Latinoamérica y el mundo, y logrará inspirar a muchas personas a perseguir sus sueños. Como somos estudiantes, necesitamos del apoyo de ustedes para que este proyecto se haga realidad.
¿QUÉ NECESITAMOS?
Necesitamos juntar US$10.920 para Abril de 2013.Estos fondos cubrirán solamente una parte de los costos del viaje. Los US$10.920  serán utilizados para cubrir los costos de combustible (US$3.000), el transporte por ferry del vehículo desde Panamá a Colombia (US$1.335, es la única forma de cruzar debido a que los divide el Tapón de Darién que es una selva densa), alimentos (US$3.150) y alojamiento (US$3.435).También planeamos comprar cámaras y equipamientos para trabajar durante el viaje. Si superamos nuestra meta, el excedente será utilizado para cubrir estos gastos.
¿QUÉ RECIBIRÁS A CAMBIO?
Además de la satisfacción personal de saber que estás formando parte de una comunidad motivadora que alienta a realizar un viaje de crecimiento, también ofrecemos diferentes niveles de gratificaciones! Fíjate en la sección de gratificaciones en la columna derecha para más información.
¡CORRE LA VOZ!
¡Ayúdanos a expandir la voz acerca de Un Viaje al Interior! Compártelo en las redes sociales con tus amigos. Tampoco dudes en tener una conversación personal o hacer una llamada telefónica para compartirlo. ¡Todas las acciones cuentan!!!!
 
ENGLISH VERSION
What is AN INNER JOURNEY?
An Inner Journey is an adventure of more than 12,000 miles across 17 countries in Latin America. In this journey we want you to get involved in the discovery of the potential of people committed to the pursuit of excellence in education, work and wellbeing, in order to transform our environment, our countries and the world.
An Inner Journey aims to spark the curiosity for traveling, growing and learning, while encouraging people to seek opportunities beyond their immediate limits. Compiling inspiring talks and interviews with people in the countries we visit, and sharing them with thousands of people will give inspiration to achieve the extraordinary.
WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?
An Inner Journey is a non-profit project, but it cannot be costless. Nevertheless, we are convinced that this project will have a significant impact because it will inspire many people to travel, explore and learn. As we are students, we need your support to make this project happen!
WHAT DO WE NEED?
We need to raise US$10,920 by April 2013.These funds will partially cover the costs of the journey. The (US$ 10,920 will be used to cover fueling costs (US$ 3,000), transporting the car from Panama to Colombia by ferry (US$ 1,335) -which is the only way to cross the border because the road ends in the dense jungle of the Darien Gap- food (US$ 3,150) and accommodation (US$ 3,435).We also plan to purchase cameras and equipment to record the journey. So, if we exceed US$10,920, the surplus will be used to cover these expenses.

WHAT DO YOU GET?

Besides the personal satisfaction of knowing you are helping to create an online motivational community and encouraging other people to create their own journey, we also offer multiple-level sponsorship perks!  Check out the perks section for more information.
SPREAD THE WORD!
Help us get the word out about An Inner Journey!  Share it with your friends through the social networks. Don't be afraid to go old school and have a conversation in person or make a telephone call!  Every action counts!

story:
Most people don’t have a clue what they are doing with their money. You can fix that.

The Problem

I’ve worked in finance and on Wall Street for years and I learned that when it comes to holding on to cash most people were idiots. All too often ‘a fool and his money are soon parted’ was all too prophetic. Usually it didn’t matter how smart they were in other areas, when it came to managing their money, they were lost. Here’s a perfect example, I had a client who was a doctor. He was a brilliant surgeon, and a really smart guy but he wondered why he was losing money every year. He showed me his portfolio that he thought was really well managed. He had 7 different accounts at 7 different brokers in an attempt to diversify and spread his investments around. I showed him that all 7 accounts were actually invested in the same 2 mutual funds and all he was doing was paying 7 times the account fees.

I don’t blame most people for not knowing how to best manage their money. Investing is tough. Unless you have an MBA, it’s hard to understand what a quarterly earnings statement is, or analyst estimates, management composition, and all the other things that go into understanding how investments and the stock market work and more importantly how to make it work for you. The last thing you want to do with your money is lose it, and investing in the stock market is terrifying water for the uneducated to tread.

Unfortunately, the people who need an investment education the most are generally the ones who can’t afford it. They can’t afford to pay expensive brokers or go back to school, and so they tend to underperform the people who can. That’s not right.

The Solution

I knew there had to be a better way to teach people how to invest. I figured any solution had to include 3 things.  First, it had to be completely risk free. If people thought they would lose money, they wouldn’t take risks at all. Second, I needed to relate investment principles to something everyone already understands so they could focus on the core principles not financial jibber jabber. While there are lots of available virtual stock market games all they do is let you play with fake money, they don’t teach you how to invest using something you already understand. And third, it had to be fun. Investment concepts take a while to sink in so if it was fun, people would come back over and over and over again, and those concepts would start to solidify.

So I created Sport Stocks. Sport Stocks is a free fantasy stock market that teaches people how to invest in the stock market using something almost everyone understands and at least has seen … sports teams. Sport Stocks uses professional and college sports like stocks in the stock market.

Here’s how it works:

You sign up for a free account. It is completely free, no money is exchanged at all and we don’t ask for a credit card. You get $100,000 of fantasy Sport Stocks cash to invest in your favorite teams. So instead of buying shares of Microsoft and Boeing in the real world, you buy fantasy shares in the Yankees and Lakers. The stocks trade in real time, every day, just like the real stock market. To encourage you to come back often and really let the concepts sink in we offer incentives in the form of prizes that we award monthly, quarterly, and annually to the top portfolios.

I love this method because almost everything that happens in the real world happens on Sport Stocks. We provide tons of information showing how what you do  on Sport Stocks would work in the real world. As you play the game you learn to take control of your financial future, learning how to manage a portfolio. The game is designed to be accessible to adults and kids, leading to a whole new generation of more financially knowledgeable, prepared, and proactive people.

What We've Done So Far, and Why We Need Your Help!

I knew you wouldn’t want to contribute to just a concept, so my team and I built a basic version of the game and put it online to reach as many people as we could as easily as possible. You can see it at www.SportStocks.com. The foundation has been laid but there is so much more we need to do to get this out to the people who need it most. We decided to come to Indiegogo so we could run this project in a way that would benefit the users, not just the way that would make the most for investors. Your contribution would go towards expanding the game and the educational tools. For example, we want to produce really interactive and entertaining videos so that our users can better understand the concepts we’re trying to teach. Finally, we want to tour high schools and universities, working with kids and teachers on how we can best implement Sport Stocks into the curriculum to teach kids earlier, rather than later, and set them up for future financial success. 

I’ve invested everything I have to get a basic platform out there. I need your help to finish developing the project to its full potential and into the hands of those who need it most. To thank you for your contributions I’ve put together some fantastic rewards, so take a look and see how you can help us improve America!

Our Rewards!

Thanks so much for your generous contribution! We know the poor economy has made is very tough to contribute to a campaign like this, and we want you to know we really appreciate it. On top of knowing you've done something great for the future of America, we've come up with some fantastic rewards for you. Indiegogo limits our space to tell you about each reward, so know that each higher donation also get ALL OF THE LOWER REWARDS AS WELL! So, if you donate $250, not only do you get the Sponsored League reward, but you also get the Sport Stocks Cash, PLUS the shirt PLUS the hat PLUS the public thank you, etc.

story:
About Me

Ciao a tutti!  My name is Lizzie and I am currently a sophomore at Edmonds Community College in the Business program.  Since starting college in 2011, I have held a nearly full-time job and a 3.7 GPA, which includes making the Dean’s List four consecutive quarters, including summer quarter.

Vince Lombardi once said:  “The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.”  My hard work and drive has brought me to an amazing opportunity this spring.  Next month I will be studying abroad in Florence, Italy for the duration of my spring term.  Alongside a dozen other Washington State Community College students, I will be taking a full course-load of Italian Life and Culture, Creative Writing, and Classic Italian Literature.  This opportunity means the world to me as I haven’t had the typical college experience; in Italy I will live in apartment-style housing with two to three roommates.  Also, I have never traveled outside of the United States, besides Canada, so this is truly a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity.  Unfortunately with this kind of experience comes high cost.  My parents are helping as much as they can, and I save as much as possible, but even community college tuition is rising!

 

What I Need & What You Get

I’ve created this campaign to help pay for my home institution costs, in part.  Even though I'm studying abroad through AIFS, I still have to pay my spring quarter tuition directly to Edmonds Community College.  Spring quarter’s tuition is $1,300 and I am hoping to raise half.  Thus far, I have paid for the program fees and my airfare.  In consideration of your donation to my campaign, I have some great perks lined up.

Perks include a thank you email, a postcard, an email with a photo of me at a historical location in Florence, and an original writing piece, depending on your level of contribution.

 

The Impact

By studying abroad I hope to gain more appreciation and knowledge about the world that otherwise can’t be experienced through textbooks or internet research.  I have never been outside of the United States, with the exception of Canada, so this would be a huge step for me culturally and intellectually.  I want to learn how others live day-to-day life and expand my world view.  I feel with study abroad, it will allow me to have a less-biased perspective toward other cultures and people.  I anticipate that I will also learn more about myself through this experience.  I expect that by immersing myself into another culture, my beliefs and values will strengthen, or even change, due to my experiences in Florence.    

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re unable to donate, you can follow my blog at http://lbitaly.blogspot.com/ and leave me words of encouragement!

story:
We began with a simple idea 

There’s a lot of suffering here on the Thailand-Burma border. Poverty is breaking people’s spirits while the lack of access to information and education is fracturing our community.

So a few of us have set out to create change. We started with the belief that hope for a community in peril can come from within. We began with the idea that the voices of the young Burmese migrants, refugees and students can uplift our own community to new heights.

Our idea was The Young Generation’s Note (YGN). YGN is a free monthly Burmese journal that’s meant to inform, educate and empower migrants and refugees with news, original articles, writings, poems, literatures and cartoons that they otherwise would never have access to.

To do this, we would train local Burmese youth and students in journalism, writing and media so they can learn useful skills while getting the opportunity to share their voices and be apart of something to uplift their own community.

 

Our Mission

Our first journal began in late-2011 with our group printing a few copies and passing it out to our local community. Today, YGN is a free 48-page journal that’s publishing 250 issues per month and growing. While this may not seem like much, our 250 journals are shared in communal spaces where they reach nearly 900 people each month.

Our journals are now in 2 refugee camps, 80 different migrant schools, 7 different community libraries and 25 organization centers. We pay for the costs of publishing our free Burmese journals by selling YGN English journals locally and online, as well as selling ad spaces to local businesses.

 

How your contributions will make an impact

We’re raising $3,000 to help YGN accomplish several important milestones. We need the funds to do the following:

(1) YGN Skill Training Program  -- we want to start offering classes to local Burmese migrant and refugee students so we can train them on journalism, writing, media and other skills. We already have the students signed-up, the office space and the teachers/mentors.

What we don’t have are any chairs, tables or basic equipments to provide these classes. Once we have these things, we’ll be able to train dozens of students each month so they can help themselves and their communities.

(2) Meet the high demand for Burmese journals -- simply put, we need to print a lot more journals. We want to print up to 500 issues a month so we can double our reach to nearly 2,000 people each month.

This is important because the Burmese refugee and migrant communities have grown to rely on our journals for updates on what’s happening in the world and in their community. They’re looking to the voices of their youth to help inform, educate and uplift them.

(3) Become self-sustaining within 6 months -- we realize that printing more journals to meet higher demand will also increase costs. This is why this campaign is especially important to help us define the path towards self-sufficiency.

With the funds, we’ll also be able to cover basic operating costs for 6 months, which will give us the time to recruit dozens of qualified members from our skill training program. This will give us the manpower we need to be able to sell our YGN English journals in more places locally and online, as well as sell more ad spots.

How we’ll prioritize your contributions

$3,000 will help cover the following:

  1. $500 -- purchase desks, chairs, whiteboards, basic office supplies for our training program
  2. $600 -- purchase an office desktop PC for communal use.
  3. $1,900 -- will cover 6-7 months of office & other overhead costs

If we can reach $4,500, we’ll be able to:

  1. Purchase an additional desktop PC to provide computer skills training to more students efficiently
  2. Be able to cover office overhead for up to 12 months

 

Help spread the word!

Whether you contribute a little, a lot or even nothing at all, we’d still appreciate you helping us spread the word. Here’s a few ways you can help us spread the word. Find these buttons on the top of the page, right below the video.

  1. If you love us, why won’t you “Like” us? Click the Like button to share on FaceBook
  2. You can also Tweet, +1 on Google+ or e-mail our campaign directly to your circles

story:
SEE MY PITCH HERE: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5Nwos2Pu9MA

http://jamaica-gleaner.com/gleaner/20130805/news/news1.html

My name is Kirk-Anthony Hamilton. I am a young entrepreneur from Kingston, Jamaica. I have been accepted to attend this year's One Young World Leadership Summit in South Africa! This is a high level summit for under 30 leaders from around the world. I am very excited for the opportunity to sit amongst some of the brightest young minds in the world at an event that attracts the likes of iconic leaders such as Kofi Annan and Former US President Bill Clinton.

The funds being raised will go to the One Young World Charity and to help offset travel expenses. One Young World is a unique charity geared towards helping young people make lasting relationships to create positive change. 

I have chosen to crowd fund to help highlight the power of this platform for young people in the Caribbean. Too often we allow opportunities to pass us by due to a lack of resources and I hope this might encourage and inspire other individuals in the region to find creative ways to pursue their goals and dreams. 

The cost of the summit is US$4800, this represents the charitable component of funds being raised and I expect travel expenses to sit in the region of US$2000. Delegates for the summit typically raise funds via various sponsors - I have chosen to crowd fund the sponsorship. Indiegogo charges a fee which will be deducted from the amount raised. 

Those who know me know I am very passionate about leadership, philanthropy and impactful positive change for the Caribbean Region. My generation in the Caribbean has witnessed the effects of poor leadership and stifling beauracracy - I want to be an active part of the solution that will help change the future of our countries. 

I think this summit is a useful first step - giving myself and others the opportunity to connect with like minded individuals in a focused environment. After the summit I will return home to implement some of the ideas I come across and also help mentor other individuals who may later attend the summit.

I have a history of philanthropic activity, most notable in 2011 I hosted the Global Party in Kingston Jamaica raising funds and awareness for Chain of Hope Jamaica. A charity that supports the Bustamante Children's Hospital (Jamaica's only children's hospital) in Kingston, Jamaica.

I look forward to your contribution. No matter the amount, It will be much more than appreciated!

story:
As we have seen from the tragedy of Malala Yousafzai, who has been fighting for her rights to an education, Pakistan's public school system is failing. Unless their families are wealthy enough to afford private school tuition, it's almost impossible for a underclass Pakistani girl to receive an education.

About: The Dhala School for Girls was founded with charitable donations to help educate the daughters of the house servants, gardeners, and rickshaw drivers of Lahore's upperclass neighborhood of Modeltown. Classes offered at the school include Urdu, English, mathematics, and Qur'an memorization.

The Need: The school's funds are so low that class openings are determined on a monthly basis, depending on the amount they receive. A family member made a donation of less than $500 and the school was able to open up classes again for 10 girls. When the girls' classes are shut down because of low funding, they are forced to spend more time reviewing and catching up rather than learning new material. 

I was invited to the The Dhala School for Girls with the hopes that a few of my photographs might highlight the struggles of the school and help raise money to support it. 

Your donation will help sustain funding for the school's current classes for the next year. Any extra donations will go towards the student's meals and a much-needed renovation of the school's facility. My mom and aunt have worked closely with the school's administrators, and will take responsibility to ensure that every donation will go towards bettering these girl's lives.

-Nushmia Khan
