story:
Project Summary

Bibz is an Xbox360 and PC game made by-youth for-youth. It blends education, art, and play to educate and empower youth to tackle global poverty.  The game teaches players about millennium development goals, geography, gender equality and more.

Kids aged 6-16 from Ethiopia, Australia, and Canada have contributed to the game’s artwork, creating everything from level designs to character animations. Everyone involved in the project has volunteered their time, and all proceeds from the sale of the game are going to be donated to Beyond the Orphanage, a non-profit that helps to support orphans in Ethiopia.

To learn more checkout: http://www.bibzgame.com

Who's behind the project?

I'm David Rust-Smith, and I'm a software developer passionate about leveraging technology for social benefit. I have a small web development business focused on tech and social benefit: www.smewebsites.com .

I think video games have a tremenduous amount of power, and I hope to use them to bring a true sense of international equality to our next generation.

If you have any questions, suggestions, or concerns contact me: david@smewebsites.com
 

Why we need $500

  • $140: Hosting a launch event for local media people: newspaper, magazines, bloggers, etc. We've managed to get space donated, but we need to get some food, drinks, basic event type stuff.
  • $120: Printing promotional material for the game, flyers, posters etc.
  • $220: Buying some online and offline ad space.
  • Hey that doesn't add up to $500! The rest is for Indiegogo and banking fees that everyone has to pay.

Let me count the ways....

The great thing about this project is how many different ways it helps youth.

  • Promotes creativity and art in youth, while exposing them to technology.
  • It's empowering, youth get to have control over a real product, and help to work on something for a good cause.
  • Teaches game players about international development, gender equality, geography, and more.
  • All profits from the game directly support orphans in Ethiopia at Beyond
    The Orphanage

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our game, and indiegogo campaign.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/#!/BibzGame

Facebook:http://www.facebook.com/#!/bibzgame

Bibzgame: http://www.bibzgame.com

What if we get more than $500...

I'm hoping to run a couple of summer camp sessions to get kids in neighbourhoods around my city creating artwork for the game's first big update. I would use the extra money for supplies for the camp.

I would also use extra money to hire a couple of the older students who have been involved in the project to create a web version of the game so people with Macs and Linux can play it.

 

*Game Requirements:

PC with a graphics card that supports Directx9.0c -or- Xbox360 with internet access
 
 

Video Transcript

Hi,

I'm David Rust-Smith and I'm the creator of BiBz. Bibz is an international Xbox and PC game made by youth for youth. it blends education, art, and play to teach players about millennium development goals, geography, gender equality and more.

Kids from Ethiopia, Australia, and Canada have contributed to the game’s artwork, creating everything from level designs to character animations.

By getting youth involved in the creation of the game and having them work with peers across the world, we can help our future generation have a real sense of global community, and understanding.

Everyone involved in the project has volunteered their time from designers to developers. The game is in the final stages of being released, but I need $500 to properly launch it.

This money will go towards promoting the game to the media, as well as printing promotional material, and buying ad-space. I've setup lots of great rewards for sponsors, everything from getting your kids artwork in the game, to a custom version of the game branded just for you.

All proceeds from the sale of the game are going to be donated to Beyond the Orphanage, an organization that helps to support orphans in Ethiopia.

For more details on the project or the game, checkout the info below, or our website:

bibzgame.com

What ever support you can provide is much appreciated. Together we can make a difference.

Thank you!

Thank you!

story:
We are so pleased to announce that, for the first time ever, Leesville Road Elementary has qualified to attend the “Odyssey of the Mind” World Finals!  In the last week of May our team of three 3rd graders, two 4th graders and two 5th graders will descend upon Iowa State University to participate in a four-day competition and take their shot at becoming World Champs.  Teams throughout the United States and 25 other countries will participate in this prestigious event.  We need your support!

Flights, travel, room and board for our young students and chaperones is a costly endeavor – that is why I am asking for your help.  We need to raise more than $10,000 in less than seven weeks to enable our team to attend this event.  We hope that you will help us hit our fundraising goal and allow our team to showcase all of their creativity and hard work – not to mention represent North Carolina and our Community.

“Odyssey of the Mind is an international educational program that provides creative problem-solving opportunities for students from kindergarten through college. Team members apply their creativity to solve problems that range from building mechanical devices to presenting their own interpretation of literary classics.” www.odysseyofthemind.com  

Our team’s long-term problem was to re-enact a driver’s test with a team-built vehicle (see picture) that can carry a student using two different propulsion systems while completing a set of required tasks.  They created a vehicle, developed a skit, wrote music and built props for the performance.  Their hard work paid off – they received the top score for the long term problem and second place overall, when they competed at State Finals on April 5th.  The top two teams at the state level move on to World Finals.

There is a mixture of delight and disbelief that the kids have an opportunity to participate in this once-in-a-lifetime event.  We hope that you can support us in this endeavor with a monetary donation; no donation is too big or too small!  

You can fund us through this site or you can make a tax deductible donation to the following:

Leesville Road Elementary (include “Odyssey of the Mind” in the memo line)

8402 Pride Way
Raleigh, NC 27613

Thank you for supporting Leesville Road Elementary.

Sincerely,

Coach Andy and David

story:
Dear Beloved;

Amazing News! I have been invited to learn and serve with Heidi and Rolland Baker at Iris Ministries’ Harvest Missions School in Pemba, Mozambique this summer from June to August. Heidi and Rolland have cared for thousands of orphans in Mozambique since 1995. For several years, I have dreamed of working with them, and I‘ve felt that the Lord has been telling me that I would one day do so. I am so humbled and honored to become one of their students this summer.

In October 2012, Mama Heidi, as she is known by those she cares for, prayed over me and I was instantly filled with a passion to see the nations brought into true discipleship of Jesus Christ. The following summer, I spent six weeks in Medellín, Colombia with Open Arms Foundation where I spent time working with ten of the most rascally and hilarious street boys through whom the Lord taught me so much about how to love unconditionally. The Lord has worked on my heart here in the States as well; I am currently serving Regent University Campus Ministries as a Lifegroup Leader where I have learned how to establish and maintain community and joy among some of the students on campus. Now, it has come full circle, and I am off to Mozambique!

I have been accepted to attend Iris Ministries’ Harvest Missions School in Pemba, Mozambique the summer! I have prayed and I feel that it is time to continue to grow in knowledge and understanding of Christ’s love for the nations and step into this next part of the great adventure He has for me, but I need your help.

I need to raise at least $3,000 by April 25th $2,000 of which will be raised on this website, to pay for my tuition; after that, I need to raise around $1,500 for my plane ticket and some living expenses. Around $4,500 total. This is where you come in...

I am calling out to everyone I know to pray and hopefully support this great adventure that the Lord is sending me on. Please consider supporting me while I pursue the Kingdom in Africa; if not financially, then please lift up prayers for me. Your prayers are precious to me and I thank you for taking time to read this letter.

Yours in Christ;

R. Michael Wilcher

If you’d like to support Michael while he seeks God’s Kingdom in Mozambique, please give on this website or send cash, checks, or notes of encouragement to:

R. Michael Wilcher

1108 Crystalwood Cir.

Chesapeake, Virginia 23320

For more information email Michael at:

robewil@mail.regent.edu

story:
Short Summary

Up Rising Stars Inc. a family run, 501c3 non- profit organization (Tax ID: 45-3358664) operated by Danielle Worth, Darcell Worth, and Keiana Worth. This organization was founded in September, 2011 to give back to the community, to be able to assist students achieve their dreams. As a family we believe that everyone is a rising star. 

Up Rising Stars Inc. gives out scholarships to deserving high school students that plan on attending college. We want our youth to know that we care and are willing to provide resources so their dreams can become a reality

The name of our scholarship is called  "The Phillip Dorsey Scholarship Award" and it is in loving memory of Phillip Dorsey, who was Keiana Worth's father and Danielle Worth's step-father. Phillip Dorsey was a man who cared about people and helping others and particularly our youth. Anyone that knew him loved his commitment to helping someone in need. We are happy to carry on his legacy by helping individuals achieve their dreams as they pursue a higher education by attending college.

This campaign is important to us because it will help us assist more high school students attend collage. All of the contributors are extremely important because everyone either has a family member in high school or they know someone that is in high school. We know the value of education and that is why we want to help our youth by investing in their future.

 We want to provide multiple students with a scholarship. Due to rising cost of education many families simply do not have the funds to send their child to college, so that is where we come in. You contribution will give more students the opportunity to attend college.  We also provide the students with a trophy and  books for their journey to attend college and your contribution will enable us to continue that.

This campaign is very valuable because your contribution can be the game changer in a child's life and potentially change the direction of their lives. If we all gave a small contribution to a child's education than they would have less debt when they graduate and would not have to take out as many college loans.

If you can not make a contribution please share this campaign with a friend or someone that may want to help our youth attend college.  We would love your help to get the word out about the campaign so we can assist as many high schools students as possible. We are also interested in bringing passionate people on board who want to assist in providing resources for our future leaders of tomorrow.

 www.uprisingstareinc.org

www.facebook.com/www.uprisingstarsinc

www.twitter.com/UP_Rising_Stars

story:
On Monday 8th September, some of the world’s most famous YouTube stars are starting a school with a difference, to help raise money for children who don’t have access to education.

For five days, YouTube stars like me will be stepping back into the virtual classroom and learning something completely new, before sharing it with our fans around the world.  In exchange for pushing ourselves outside the comfort zone, we’re asking viewers to support us by donating whatever they can.

Millions of children worldwide won’t be going back to school this September, because they simply don't have access to education - especially kids living on the streets, in slums, in refugee camps and in areas of conflict. Education can be a powerful route out of poverty and without it many people are trapped in these desperate situations.

Money raised will be spent by Comic Relief UK to help children from vulnerable and disadvantaged backgrounds to go to school and receive a life-changing education.

Examples of how your donation could help:

£5 could pay for a literacy book for a young person in conflict-stricken Somalia, helping them get the education they need.

£10 could buy a school uniform for a child living on the streets of Ghana, which they need to go to school so they can get vital skills and work towards a brighter future.

£60 could pay for a Zambian orphan to go to secondary school for a whole year, offering them hope, safety and life-changing access to education.

£300 could pay for a female mentor to work in a school for an entire year in a poor area of Ghana to encourage girls to stay in school and help them get a better education.

story:
About Me

Hi I'm Serena and my goal is to obtain my PhD in Conflict Resolution & Reconciliation at Trinity College Dublin in Ireland Fall-2014.

I am incredibly excited to pursue this degree and to dedicate myself to teaching and the creation of a future non-profit helping children in both conflict and post-conflict societies through the arts.

I have worked in conflict ridden societies throughout my educational and professional career.  I have an innate passion to work for the betterment of the world and common good.

The Goals and Impact

- Obtain a PhD in Conflict Resolution & Reconciliation from Trinity College Dublin.

- Utilize knowledge obtained to develop future non-profit tasked with empowering individuals without a voice; helping children in both conflict and post-conflict societies through the arts.

- Foster peace through education 
     - Collaborate and implement peace education programs in US schools.

     - Obtain a professorship in Conflict Resolution.

     - PAYING IT FORWARD! Create a scholarship program for students who desire to foster peace in their communities (A perk that can allow you to have the scholarship named after you!).

What Your Donation Contributes to

Tuition 1 year: 8885 Euro ($12,284.40 USD)*

http://www.tcd.ie/financial-services/fees/fees_coursefees.php 

Living Costs 1 year: 13176 Euro ($18,217.14 USD)*

http://www.educationinireland.com/en/Living-in-Ireland/Before-Arrival/Living-Costs/

*Calculated USD amount at the current exchange rate as of today (03.29.14) of 1 Euro:1.38 USD

Why You Should Donate

This research, future non-profit, implementation of peace education programs, and scholarship program will have positive long term impacts from the grassroots to international level.  Be a part of bettering the world!

Other Ways You Can Help: Spread the Word!

If you can't contribute financially, you can still support this campaign by spreading the word and sharing it with others!

story:
Do you know anyone that needs to get out of their comfort zone? Kids need to network with their peers in a safe indoor environment.  And we want to give it to them!

Not only do we want to bring Zones Of Fun to our youths, but we also want to provide a service to the community.  In our initial launch stage, The Zone will set-up an internet cafe.  Believe it or not, but there is still 29% of households without a computer or internet access outside of school/work.  Additionally, according to the U.S. Census Bureau, 49% of minority households are without a computer or internet access. One of our initial Zones will be a designated area for computer and internet access for students to complete homework outside of school/library hours.  Moreover, with suicide being the second leading cause of death worldwide for 15-29 year olds, The Zone intends to launch a peer to peer interaction program.  These items would make a great addition to any community.
So please find it in your heart to help our launch, remember no donation is too small. 

Imagine

It's scorching hot out. Anything outdoors is unimaginable.  And everyone's going absolutely mental. Instead of locking yourself up in the house and hoping for the best, head down toThe Zone instead.

With themed laser tag, pinball machines, arcade video games, karaoke, internet cafe and driving simulators, there's more than enough to keep the ankle biters entertained during the day. Or choose a private session because admit it - you can't wait to spend quality time with the family running through our laser tag battlefield.


The Breakdown Of What We Need From You:


Your contribution will allow us to provide customers with a full featured Internet cafe, peer to peer counseling, interactive gaming, food court, and karaoke bar. An unique, upscale, and innovative environment is required to provide the customers with an atmosphere that will spawn socialization. Successful operation in year one will provide us with a customer base that will allow it to be self sufficient in year two and beyond.

  • 10,000 sodas or cups of coffee - For 10,000 sacrifices of a $2 soda/coffee gets The Zone of the ground.  Donate your soda/coffee to help us and your nutrition.  Encourage your friends and family help us and their nutrition by skipping the soda/coffee with a donation.
  • The $20,000 goal will help us complete the launch of our internet cafe with volunteers while expanding into the final stages
  • Any funding over our goal will help us get closer to our final stage.
  • A goal of $200,000 will immediately fund, launch, and complete our upscale proposed plan with working capital for year one and two.

With the initial goal funded we can redesign the space, and purchase gaming equipment.  If we exceed our goal then we will begin the next stages of hiring additional staff, ordering additional equipment, and purchase grand opening supplies. At $90,000 we will launch the completed proposed version of The Zone to get the kids and family interacting immediately.  We believe this company will be a huge success as there is currently no facility similar within a 20+ mile radius.


What You Get:

We want you to feel just as valued as the youth we plan to reach; therefore, our perks start with just a $2 donation:

  • For your sacrifice of just one of your daily sodas or cups of coffee $2  ~ Your sacrifice of your one coffee cup or your daily soda can get us started in the right direction.  Every penny adds up to the launch of after school fun. So for one of your daily soda/coffee sacrifice we will send you a heartfelt thank you email to know you are keeping kids out of trouble. 

  • In lieu of lunch $10  ~ In lieu of a lunch outing you chose to help keep kids busy and out of trouble after school, and for this we offer you a heartfelt thank you, update of progress, and photos from grand opening.

  • Bronze Package $100 ~ Our Bronze Level includes: Our Heartfelt thank you email acknowledging your gift; One (1) T-shirt with our logo; An update email with photos and a video tour of our pre-grand opening 

  • Silver Package $500 ~ For your generosity, you will receive the bronze package with the following additions: Five (5) T-shirts with our company logo and admission for two (2) to stop by anytime you're in the area

  • Gold Package  $1,000 ~ The gold package includes the silver package with the addition of the following: 1.) Admission for you and four (4) guest to our grand opening 2.) Your name scrolling in lights 3.) Two (2) travelers mug with our logo

  • Platinum Package $10,000 ~ The Platinum Package includes everything in the gold package plus the following: Plaque acknowledging your gift; Tour of our facility; Eight (8) additional travel mugs with our logo; Ten (10) admission redemption certificates; A donation of 5% of our first year profits (up to $10,000 max.) to a non-profit charity of your choosing in your name

  • Benefactor Package $200,000 ~ All campaigning ceased and donors refunded (except you). Your gift will be the platinum package and the following: Our party room named after you or your company; PDF of our business plan; Meet and greet over lunch after tour; 10 additional T-shirts, 10 additional travel mugs, and a plaque; A donation of 5% of our profits (up to $200,000 max) in your name to a non-profit charity of your choice; and Advertise your company name (or your name as a legacy) to 250,000+ youth as our benefactor

What if we don't make our goal?

  • We will make our goal, but in the unfortunate case that we do not we will access the amount to bring as much as we possibly can to our youth community.
  • Please note that if the money we receive is less than a month of rent then we will refund all donors and thank them for stepping out on faith with us.
  • Remember we plan to make it!


Our Keys to Success

To provide the community children with a local safe indoor entertainment technology center.


  • Located steps away from one of four high schools within the city limit with student body of 4100+
  • We're in one of the largest school district in the state of California, translates to appox. 65,000+ school attendees
  • Located within walking distance of 3 large kid friendly neighborhoods, and four (4) parks
  • Becoming the first business catering the 18 year old and under crowd within the city limits
  • Remaining affordable and on the cutting edge


Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people just can't contribute and we understand but can you help us another way:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise for us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Snapchat and Instagram.
  • Have a skill then volunteer at our facility.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word for us and that's all there is to it.

LET’S GET STARTED!

We will make our goal, but in the unfortunate case that we do not we will access the amount to bring as much as we possibly can to our youth community.
Please note that if the money we receive is less than a month of rent then we will refund all donors and thank them for stepping out on faith with us.
Remember we plan to make it!



Our Keys to Success
To provide the community children with a local safe indoor entertainment technology center.

Located steps away from one of four high schools within the city limit with student body of 4100+


We're in one of the largest school district in the state of California, translates to appox. 65,000+ school attendees


Located within walking distance of 3 large kid friendly neighborhoods, and four (4) parks


Becoming the first business catering the 18 year old and under crowd within the city limits

Remaining affordable and on the cutting edge





Other Ways You Can Help:
Some people just can't contribute and we understand but can you help us another way:

Help us get the word out and make some noise for us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Snapchat and Instagram.
Have a skill then volunteer at our facility.
Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word for us and that's all there is to it.
LET’S GET STARTED!

story:
Hello Everyone,

 Welcome to the IndieGoGo campaign for A Gathering of Stitches! Thank you for checking out what we're all about. 

What is A Gathering of Stitches?

A Gathering of Stitches is a workshop, studio, and maker lab for fiber and textile artists, craftspeople and small businesses in Portland, Maine. Our mission is to share the modern and historical world of the needle arts through education, shared resources and equipment, small business development, and the creation of community. In simple terms, we're going to teach people to:

                  sew : knit : dye : quilt : embroider : crochet : screen print

Instruction will be available at all levels. We'll also supply access to specialized equipment, and provide a creative space for businesses to grow, all for the Southern Maine and Northern New England community.

 Crowdfunding is the perfect way to help us build this community enterprise. We have invested our own money, time and capital, but want to invite you to support the purchase of specialized equipment for this community enterprise.

 While the rent for this space is reasonable, the cost of launching this business is formidable.  The money we raise through this campaign will help cover build-out of the space, administrative software and set up, office and studio furniture, and specialized, professional-grade equipment.

What Will I Find There When It's Ready?

A Gathering of Stitches will have sergers and knitting machines, irons, ironing boards, and dress forms as well as items that are hard for individual crafters to access, such as free motion quilting machines, screen printing equipment and a dyeing set-up.  In addition, we are building a large library of books on all aspects of fiber and textiles, which will be at hand for research and education.

 This is your opportunity to help grow the world of fiber arts! For each piece of equipment you fund you will receive our eternal gratitude, a thank you on our donors page, the knowledge that others will be learning with the equipment, and, most importantly, the rights to name the piece!  Call it Sally, call it Stitch, name it after your favorite Aunt, your childhood pet, your mortal enemy. Consider it your patronage for the fiber arts in Northern New England.  It is your legacy and we encourage you to have fun with it! If you are unable to donate at this time, please share our story with your friends and family. Community is built by word of mouth, and your support means the world to us!

Whose Project is This?

 A Gathering of Stitches is the brainchild of two women who love craft and the fiber arts: Samantha Hoyt Lindgren and Molly Bergman Quaid. Samantha is a partner in Rabelais, the specialized cookbook shop here in Maine. She is a life long knitter and sewist, having made her own clothes at various stages in her life from the teens to the present. She's had many careers, including as a photographer and photo editor for major publications such as People, Forbes, and Life; as a dancer, which she practiced from childhood into her mid-twenties, including a stint with the Bill T. Jones dance company in the 1980s; and as a baker and a graduate from the Institute of Culinary Education.  Her career has been a crazy patchwork, but it's led to the creation of a new home for the needle arts in Portland, Maine, and all these varied skills have prepared her for this business of sewing together a stitching community.

 Molly is a native New Englander who grew up surrounded by handcrafts. Her grandmothers were dedicated knitters and seamstresses and her great-aunt loved to create hooked rugs. A teacher taught Molly to cast on in the first grade and began her lifelong love of knitting. Molly also spent many happy hours of her childhood on her Aunt’s Singer sewing machine.  Since then, she's held positions as a researcher, market analyst, and worked in politics, but has spent her spare time in art school, hosting a knitting circle, and seeking out yarn shops wherever she travels. She believes everyone can make beautiful things to wear and decorate their homes and is excited to be working with Samantha to create a space and build a community for fiber artists and crafters.

Where Will A Gathering of Stitches Be?

 Molly and Samantha have found a fabulous location in the East Bayside area of Portland, Maine, an industrial area that’s already home to creative businesses such as Tandem Coffee Roasters, Bunker Brewing, Rising Tide Brewing, The Urban Farm Fermentory, Running With Scissors Artists Studios, Portland Power Yoga, and Zero Station. The 4400 square foot space will be dedicated to large scale equipment, instruction areas and artist studios. We think the cross pollination of ideas that happens when artists and students work together in the same space is limitless. 

Thanks! 

 We are so very excited to be working on this project and are thrilled with the responses we have gotten to it over the past few months. The community is urging us on and we are honored by their encouragement. We look forward to becoming a permanent part of this vibrant fiber and textile world for years to come.  Thank you for your support in making our vision a reality!

story:
My name is Ahmad Saffi. On July 1, I made a decision to leave my job and fly to Nepal in order to volunteer teaching English. Upon my arrival at the school, I experienced a major culture shock in the education system. The school had holes in the walls, no lights and the students are left hungry and malnourished with minimal to no school meals. During my first few weeks, I still have not met all of my students as many are absent by necessity in order to work for their family.

The government has offereed free education, but these additional costs are still stunting these children's educational growth.

I ask that you help contribute to my cause if you share my dream in giving access to education to every child.

Here's the breakdown of the impact of where each dollar goes for each student:

  • $1.00 purchases a pencil, pencil sharpener, eraser, fountain pen & ink
  • $2.60 purchases a year's worth of notebooks
  • $6.00 covers the school enrollment fee for the 45 upper division students
  • $25.00 purchases 2 sets of uniforms, a backpack, sweater, shoes and 3 pairs of socks

I have worked with marginalized schools in America, but the situation in this school is so dire that the need for help is imminent. These children all share the desire to become doctors, lawyers, nurses, engineers and every other dream they may have but their situation is prohibiting them from making those dreams a reality. Your contribution can change each of these children's lives.

Pictures of these children will be posted periodically so you may see the change you are creating.

Education should not be a privilege but a necessary right. Every child should have the opportunity and access to a decent education.

story:
Details

  My name is Emily Sanders, I live in Centennial, Colorado with my parents and younger sister. I'm nineteen years old. Last September I graduated from boarding school in Salt Lake City. Attending boarding school helped me become independent and explore my interests. 

  I'm really passionate about women's rights and empowerment, I think that every girl should have the opportunity for an education. I want to be a leader in the fight to end the oppression of women and girls worldwide. I've been so inspired by movements like Half the Sky, The Girl Effect & 10x10 Girl Rising. 

  Now I have an unbelievable opportunity to serve and contribute to communities around the world with a program called Thinking Beyond Borders (TBB). I will be traveling to 6 different countries with a group of peers and mentors. We will live with host families, complete meaningful fieldwork with local experts and academic enrichment through classroom discussions and seminars with host NGO's. 

The Money Breakdown

        Program Tuition: $30,000    Fundraising Goal: $10,000    

 Thinking Beyond Borders has agreed that for every $1 I raise in this campaign, they will raise $2 towards my tuition. Your donations and this scholarship make participating in TBB possible! My goal is to raise $10,000. I will be working hard over the next few months to raise the additional money for airfare and travel expenses. 

 If for some reason I am unable to pay for my tuition, your contributions will go to the program scholarship fund and support the program and other globally minded individuals like myself. I believe in this program and the positive impact it has on its students and the world.

The Impact & Your Perks

    Your contributions not only support me as a leader for social change but support the Thinking Beyond Borders program and communities around the world.

   The focus of service in 8 months with TBB is divided into four units. Each unit addressing a global issue: Natural Resources & the Environment, Sustainable Agriculture, Education & Economic Growth and Public Health & the AIDS Epidemic.

   You will recieve perks for your donations, I spent time making the perks special and personal. I want to share my experience with you. I think it's important to show you the impact of your contribution. I'm excited to offer these perks as a thank you for all your support. 

Thank you so much for watching my video, contributing to my campaign and investing in positive change in our world!

Additional Ways You Can Help

  Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign! Share with your family, friends and local community.

Please use the resources available to share through Email, Facebook, Twitter, etc. 

Thank you so much for watching my video, contributing to my campaign and investing in positive change in our world!

View the Global Gap Year Outline & Curriculm!

story:
:) That friendly legalese above means that High Zero Foundation is our amazing nonprofit sponsor for the tour. All your donations are tax-deductible and will go towards our tour and workshops costs. 

Techne is on the road again, Summer 2014! 

Last summer TECHNE brought their DIY electronic music workshops to over a hundred young women at Girls Rock Camps in Oakland, Sacramento, Portland and Seattle, and they were a huge success!

This summer we're at it again, hitting the East Coast and Southern US, where we will be presenting workshops and concerts in 8 cities from Philadelphia, PA to New Orleans, LA.  

Who are Techne and Girls Rock Camp?

TECHNE is an arts education organization founded by musicians Bonnie Jones & Suzanne Thorpe in 2010. We teach workshops combining sound, technology and musical improvisation. Through our programs we empower young women, increase their involvement in technology, and inspire them to engage in creative and innovative music practices.

Since the first Girls Rock n' Roll Camp was founded in Portland, OR in 2001, GIRLS ROCK CAMPS have sprung up all over the US and abroad including Sweden, Brazil, Canada, and France. All camps share the unifying goal of inspiring self-esteem and mutual support among diverse young girls through musical expression.

More cities and more workshops

This year we're continuing our partnership with several US-based Girls Rock Camps with an ambitious goal of presenting workshops in 8 cities including Philadelphia, PA, Baltimore, MD, Washington, DC, Charlottesville, VA, Nashville, TN, Charleston, SC, Baton Rouge, and New Orleans, LA!

We are also adding a new twist: a concert in each city, featuring Bonnie & Suzanne in duet, and fellow local female artists. These events will provide much needed modeling of women electronic musicians practicing their craft.

and we need your support...

TECHNE workshops show girls how to build exciting new instruments with DIY electronics, explore creative sound-making techniques, and collaborate together in a fun group improvisation. We also like to sneak in key audio and technology concepts, including an overview of the physics of sound, signal flow, and basic circuitry. Nerd girl alert!

After the workshop, the girls take home a unique, self-crafted instrument and, we hope, a new and fresh perspective on music making and self-expression.

Here’s where you come in...

Girls Rock camps are independent and staffed primarily by volunteers. Each camp has to negotiate the various pressures of balancing excellent programming and staff and increasing better access to students with tight and getting tighter budgets.

By contributing to our campaign TECHNE has a chance to provide unique programming without placing additional financial burden on the individual camps.

Your support will enable TECHNE and Girls Rock camps to offer kick-ass workshops in electronic music to young women!

The money situation

TECHNE is working with each camp to secure modest funds for basic materials, however we still need to find a way to cover several of our travel, equipment, and instructor fees. 

Our working budget is outlined below so that you know exactly what your contribution will be used towards. All your donations are tax-deductible through our fiscal sponsor High Zero Foundation. 

Airfare and local transportation / $1,700
Lodging and meals / $1,150
Instructor fees for five workshops / $2,000
Administrative/overhead costs  / $1,650
Workshop materials / $1,500

If we are unable to meet our goal of $8,000, we’ll use whatever funds we do receive towards materials, airfare, and local transportation for as many workshops as feasible. 

The bigger picture 

There’s a gender gap in the world of technology. It’s a fact that women are vastly under-represented in technology fields including art, science, music, and business.

TECHNE wants to bridge that gap. We want to embolden young women to take that soldering iron, computer mouse or circuit board in hand and feel empowered by their technology skills. We want to be role models for young girls who are interested in electronic music or DIY building but hesitate because of the lack of women in the field.

But most of all, we want to inspire these young women to think critically, experiment freely and discover their own voice.

Your help supports an arts curricula rooted in technology and musical improvisation that is proven to build confidence, self-awareness, group-awareness, and problem solving techniques. If we give them the tools, they will do the rest!

As a token of our gratitude

To thank you for your amazing support TECHNE put together a few tokens of our undying gratitude! Alas, you can't come to the camp (but maybe your daughter can?), but we've got some amazing gifts including limited edition recordings from Wye Oak, signed copies of Matmos, Dinosaur Jr. and My Bloody Valentine vinyl, signed copies of Sara Marcus' Girls to the Front and Tara Rodgers' Pink Noises, and ... wait for it... autographed copies of three Patti Smith books. Are you still waiting? Well stop that and donate now!

story:
Periwinkle School 

We play to learn and learn to play.

  • About us-Periwinkle School began as a young fives program in the fall of 2005.  It started with 12 students, 2 teachers, and really great art supplies.  Beginning in the fall of 2013, Periwinkle will be an elementary school that will continue through 5th grade, with 2 full time teachers in each small class in every grade.
  • What we want -Play is disappearing from children's lives, and we want to bring play back to childhood.  Periwinkle offers strong academic preparation for each child, and still allows plenty of time for exploration through play.
  • What you can do - Help us bring play back to childhood.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Why we need funding -  Start up costs for school can be exhorbitant. We need a building with a large shared space for children to play. We believe children deserve a beautiful aesthetic and quality art supplies and materials. We think teachers should be paid well - happy teachers make good teachers.
  • What you will get - Donors will receive boxed sets cards featuring art by Periwinkle students.  Periwinkles are amazing artists because they have the best supplies and talented teachers to guide them.

The Impact

  • Too often, adults seem to be pushing children toward their futures at a rate that has very little regard for their now.  But at Periwinkle we feel that helping children create a base of flexible, creative, innovative thinking - with a strong sense of compassion and competence - will best prepare them for a future we can't imagine. 
  • Do you know the opposite of play is depression?  Help us solve the depression problem that plagues our society.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell everyone about Periwinkle.  Share the news via social media. 
  • Volunteer your time or services.  Help us fundraise or recruit.
  • Remember to let your children play.

story:
[campaña en CASTELLANO aquí]

Brief Description

The Museum and its director Alejandro Camino confront a financial emergency and need your support to continue its mission of preserving indigenous traditional knowledge on plants.

Short Summary

The Museum of Sacred, Magical and Medicinal Plants, the only one of its kind, founded in 2011 as a non-for-profit institution, presents to a lay audience a systematic body of information on the ancient indigenous healing traditions of the Amazon and the high Andes of South America. These are based in the knowledge of the properties of over 8,000 plants, few of which have been fully analyzed and still less have become available to patients worldwide in a standardize form. Our mission is to recover and disseminate information on a rich herbal tradition which is being lost at a fast rate, before it is too late.

Our increased number of visitors from all over the world (we are on the way to Machu Picchu, the lost Inca city) has not yet been enough to generate the necessary income to become sustainable. Based in the rate of growth of visitors we should be able to cover our operational costs by the end of 2014.  In the last years we have been receiving the generous support of individuals in Peru but this has come to an end. Now we confront a very difficult financial situation that will probably lead to the closing of the museum in the first semester of 2014. 

Thus, we demand your help in order to deal with our financial crisis and to start a new & improved museum in a different location as the present one is unsustainable due to the high rental costs it requires.

Also, through this campaign, we can provide all those interested in ancestral alternative medicines a unique concise illustrated publication with updated scientific information on the South American medicinal herbal wealth. We plan to send a copy of the book, free of cost, to all universities in the Andean and Amazonian region as well as to main hospitals in the region. 


What We Urgently Need & What You Get

What do we urgently need and where your contributions will go:

  • Overcome our overcome the financial emergency and re-start the museum in a different location US$ 45,000
  • Publication of the Museum Book: (bilingual edition Spanish-English version, design, printing, etc.) US$ 15,000 (*)

(*) If we don't manage to reach our target, we will use the money raised to solve part of our financial crisis. In this scenario, we will not be able to publish the book.

If you support us, you can receive the following rewards:

  • Sacred Plant Postcard - 50 US$
  • Wachuma & Willka Electronic Magazine - 75 US$
  • San Pedro Cactus Poster (Limited Edition) - 100 US$
  • Wachuma & Willka Magazine (Limited Edition) - 150 US$
  • The Museum Book (Limited Edition) - 300 US$
  • Personalized Tour to Cusco - 4000 US$ (**)

(**) Tour includes RT air travel from Lima to Cusco, two nights accomodation in Cusco, RT train ticket and guided tour by an Anthropologist throughout your visit.

A3 size - San Pedro Cactus Poster

San Pedro Cactus and Willka Magazine


The Impact

The money raised will serve us to go overcome the financial emergency and re-start the museum in a different location. We believe that although the present location is really good as it provides easy access being in the historical heart of the ancient Inca capital of Cusco city center, in order to be financially sustainable we must move out.

By changing our present location we will lower down our operative costs by 50% enabling us to lower down also our minimum amount of visitors per year. Also, by publishing the Museum Book, we address a need both of the Museum to increase our products and its visitors as they will be able to take the information back home.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

    • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
    • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

Ashleigh Nelson is 9 years old. She is in Third Grade at Elkhorn Valley Elementary School. She is very active in various activities, including 4H. Ashleigh recently received her 4H Premium Check for her efforts of showing her prized kitty, Princess and showing various produce at our local fair. This is the first "real" check that Ashleigh has ever earned!!  Ashleigh's Premium Check totaled $24 and she is VERY proud of it! Ashleigh decided that instead of purchasing an iTunes Card or heading to Claire's, she wanted to do something BIGGER with her hard earned money. So, she asked to donate the $24 to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital to help kids battling illnesses. Ashleigh has had people express interest in helping her with her goal to help kids by stating that they would like to "MATCH" her $24 donation to help make a larger donation for St. Jude!!! Ashleigh will gather up all her donations and make one BIG donation to St. Jude at the St. Jude Country Radiothon to be held February 28-29, 2012! Our local radio station, US 92 will host the event and Ashleigh hopes to bring smiles to their faces with her donation. She would LOVE to inspire more kids to want to help the kids at St. Jude and Ashleigh would LOVE your support with her fundraiser!!!


The Impact

100% of the money raised will go to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital! This money will go to help the kids battling illnesses at the St. Jude Children's Research Hospital. No child is EVER turned away from St. Jude and Ashleigh wants to do the best that she can to help those kids facing life threatening illnesses by making a difference in her community.


What We Need & What You Get

Ashleigh is requesting donations of $24 to "MATCH" her $24 donation. Of course, she would LOVE it if you would like to make a larger donation, but she is SO grateful for ANY donation that you are able to give because ALL donations will go toward helping more kids at St. Jude!!! Thank You SO VERY much for your support of Ashleigh and for helping the kids at St. Jude!!!


Other Ways You Can Help

Ashleigh would LOVE for you to share her project with others!!! Also, if you have an item that you would like to donate to Ashleigh's cause, to be raffled off or used in a silent auction, she would LOVE that as well!

Donations may be sent to:


Ashleigh Nelson

PO Box 254
Tilden, NE 68781

 

Ashleigh will put daily "THANK YOU's"  on her Facebook page thanking each and every person that donates to her cause!!!! Also, please feel free to make your donation in Honor or Memory of someone that is special to YOU! Ashleigh is very thankful for your help!!!
